image.altText: Adam Bandt speaks at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt is addressing the media after threatening to sue the attorney-general over remarks he claims were defamatory. Follow live.

title.children: Bandt speaks after threat to sue attorney-general over Gaza remarks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Peter Dutton weighs in, calls Greens 'evil'
Greens leader is asked about protest at Labor MP office
Adam Bandt is now taking questions from reporters

image.altText: A medium shot of a man in a suit and tie standing and speaking into a microphone at a lecturn. He holds up one clenched hand

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt has threatened Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus with legal action over remarks he made that Mr Bandt says were defamatory.

title.children: Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus threatened with legal action by Greens leader after Gaza protest comments

image.altText: Rain forecast over four days on map of NSW

props.synopsis: Up to 250 millimetres of rain could soak parts of south-east NSW during the next 24 hours as another major rain event unfolds across the state.

title.children: Bureau issues flood watch from Sydney to South Coast as deluge returns

image.altText: Isabel Walker Life Chances 2

props.synopsis: A long-term study of the lives of 167 babies can tell us a lot about how family bonds, wealth, education and changes to our social safety net can impact a person's life.

title.children: Destiny's child? 34 years ago researchers followed the lives of 167 babies. Now adults, their start has played a big part in their present

image.altText: A group of forensics police officers wearing blue overalls outside a home on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A scathing report identified more than 170 breaches of the NSW Police Force's own domestic violence procedures, with officers failing to do the basics like seizing guns, taking a statement, or checking CCTV footage.

title.children: 'Inexcusable failure': Damning report on one police force reflects the failures of another

image.altText: Australian passport

props.synopsis: Immigration is a hot issue in the UK and US election campaigns as arrivals surge and voters face cost-of-living pressure. But reducing migrant numbers has economic consequences too.

title.children: At the height of hand-wringing over the economic impacts of immigration, nobody bothered to ask the Reserve Bank

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a woman with brunette hair smile.

props.synopsis: The ACT has become the seventh of eight jurisdictions in the country to legalise voluntary assisted dying as the bill passed the Legislative Assembly today.

title.children: Lara watched her partner Dan battle terminal brain cancer — she's grateful for the ACT's new voluntary assisted dying laws

image.altText: Selwyn Cobbo high-fives Queensland Maroons teammate Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow during State of Origin I.

props.synopsis: Naming Selwyn Cobbo on the bench for State of Origin I could have been disastrous for Billy Slater and Queensland, but it ultimately paid off in the most predictable way imaginable.

title.children: 'Hindsight's a great thing': Slater's big bench gamble proves to not be a gamble at all in Origin I

image.altText: Two men look despondent after losing a State of Origin match

props.synopsis: Recovering from Joseph Sua'ali'i's early send-off was always going to be an impossible mission for New South Wales, and while the Blues fought to the end, the greater fallout of the tackle that rocked Origin may be yet to come.

title.children: The Blues suffered a fatal wound after eight minutes of Origin I but took plenty of time to die

image.altText: An Australian $1 coin that features Bingo and Bluey dressed up as The Grannies.

props.synopsis: The Royal Australian Mint is set to release three $1 coins featuring Australia's favourite blue heelers. The coins will depict Bluey on her own, the Heeler family together, and Bingo and Bluey dressed up as The Grannies.

title.children: Royal Australian Mint to release Bluey-themed Dollarbucks coins

image.altText: Police officers and forensic officers walking into a house surrounded with blue police tape.

props.synopsis: Manfred Uhle has been taken to jail after the court-ordered assessment found he was not suffering a mental illness.

title.children: 86-year-old accused of murdering wife not suffering a mental illness, court hears

image.altText: A woman holding a takeaway coffee cup and surgical mask next to a tree.

props.synopsis: Canberra hospitals have reintroduced mask mandates as COVID-19 and other respiratory illnesses increase.

title.children: Doctors urge calm as Canberra records spike in COVID-19 cases, hospitals introduce tighter restrictions

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Greg Lynn is giving evidence in his murder trial in Victoria's Supreme Court. He has pleaded not guilty to murdering campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay in Victoria's High Country in 2020.

title.children: Former pilot describes 'horrendous' scene as he details aftermath of campers' deaths to courtroom

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Focus turns to Mr Lynn's hunting weapons
Accused discusses fatal struggle over shotgun

image.altText: A woman in a pink top smiles sadly while looking away slightly, in front of photo wall.

props.synopsis: Naomi Bowden's tear-stained face brought a state inquiry into birth trauma to global attention, but she and other women say the inquiry's final report does not go far enough and has left them "heartbroken".

title.children: When Naomi's daughter Bella was stillborn, she was devastated. What happened next compounded her grief

image.altText: A wide shot of a rusting colonial cottage with weeds growing over it on the right hand side.

props.synopsis: When Kirsty and Mark decided to rescue and restore this 170-year-old cottage, they knew there'd be some unexpected challenges. But first they had to reclaim it from the blackberries and weeds "holding it together".

title.children: Saved from blackberries and ruin, see how one couple restored this 170-year-old cottage

image.altText: A composite image showing a shark and an echidna, both swimming in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Nicholas Lubitz witnessed the remarkable emetic incident during a three-year project that saw hundreds of marine creatures tagged off the Queensland coast.

title.children: 'Wasn't quite sitting right': Scientist shocked by sight of shark vomiting up echidna

image.altText: Oman's bowler Kaleemullah reacts to Travis Head

props.synopsis: Australia begins its T20 World Cup campaign against Asian qualifiers Oman in Barbados. Follow live.

title.children: Australia's batters struggling as Oman's bowlers relish slow pitch

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 17th over — Marcus Stoinis brings up 50 with a six
15th over — Marcus Stoinis hits four SIXES in the over
WICKET. GLENN MAXWELL IS OUT FIRST BALL

image.altText: Farmers standing in shed.

props.synopsis: Wheatbelt farmers like Kristin Lefroy are sitting on a secure water supply despite having endured a bone-dry summer and autumn. They say adopting desalination has been the key.

title.children: Five years ago these farmers' salty wells were useless. Now they are a source of pure water when it is needed most

image.altText: A Chevron off-shore gas platform

props.synopsis: A plan by oil and gas giant Chevron to leave five decommissioned oil platforms off Western Australia's Pilbara coast draws the ire of unions and green groups.

title.children: Five abandoned oil platforms to be left off WA coast by energy giant Chevron

image.altText: A white and black dog trying to poke its head out of a cat flap

props.synopsis: A cat stuck in a hole, a dog who looks like his owner, and a Tarzan flying cat are among the winners of the 2024 Comedy Pet Photo Awards.

title.children: Hector the dog trying to squeeze through a tiny cat flap wins funniest pet photo of the year

image.altText: a scientist hold up a test tube that says 'bird flu' on it

props.synopsis: A person with the first human case of a subtype of bird flu has died in Mexico City, says the World Health Organization.

title.children: First human case of bird flu strain dies in Mexico, WHO confirms

image.altText: Robert Fico sits in a leather chair and speaks to the camera looking serious, wearing a patterned button-up shirt

props.synopsis: Robert Fico has accused the country's opposition of showing hatred and aggressiveness towards his party in his first public comments since a May 15 assassination attempt.

title.children: Slovak prime minister makes first public comments since shooting attack, expects return to work

image.altText: Jane and John Newson, in their 70s, smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Jane Newson saves for a P&O cruise every year and says it's her chance to see the world when other options are too expensive. The cruise company's surprise exit from Australia after 90 years is the end of an era for her and the national icon.

title.children: P&O exiting Australia is the end of a cruising era — and 'mega ships' could be to blame

image.altText: A man holding a bronze medal.

props.synopsis: Fiji Prime Minister Sitiveni Rabuka, aged 75, wins a bronze medal in the shot-put at the Oceania Athletics Championships on Wednesday.

title.children: 'A morale booster': Fiji's 75-year-old PM wins international athletics medal for shot-put

image.altText: A train with one carriage off the track and tilted 45 degrees to its side at what appears to be a station

props.synopsis: Four people have died and 26 were injured after a passenger train collided with a freight train in the Czech city of Pardubice, according to the regional governor.

title.children: Four dead, dozens injured in Czechia train crash

image.altText: Hunter Biden, wearing a suit and US flag pin, and Melissa Cohen Biden, wearing sunglasses and a black top.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden's ex-wife and a former girlfriend testify about finding his crack pipes, and jurors are shown photos of him bare-chested in a bubble bath and told about his visit to a strip club.

title.children: Hunter Biden's exes give evidence as president's son's trial probes his personal life

image.altText: The entrance to Cranbrook School

props.synopsis: The elite Sydney private school missed two deadlines for answering questions from a parliamentary committee following an ABC investigation into allegations of a toxic culture, workplace bullying and abuse.

title.children: 'A serious matter': Private school Cranbrook criticised for lack of cooperation in federal investigation

image.altText: Alex de Minaur reacts during his straight sets loss to Alexander Zverev at the French Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's stunning French Open run ends in straight sets at the hands of German Alexander Zverev at Roland Garros. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: De Minaur's French Open run falls at the hands of German star

image.altText: Front on view of an icebreaker ship.

props.synopsis: Newly released documents show the Australian Antarctic Division issued a stern rebuke to Serco, the private operator of the RSV Nuyina, for failing to comply with strict COVID vaccination rules on a voyage to Antarctica, where an infection could have severe consequences.

title.children: 'Disappointing to see': Antarctic Division frustrated as icebreaker crew fail to get COVID jabs

image.altText: A man in his-vis gear walks past an ASX share price board.

props.synopsis: Australian shares have opened higher after gains on Wall Street overnight, including a leap in the market cap of chipmaker Nvidia. The Bank of Canada's decision to cut rates by 25 basis points for the first time since March 2020 increases hopes for the European Central Bank to follow.

title.children: Australian shares rise, Nvidia joins $3 trillion club

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Best and worst performers on the ASX

image.altText: Two swans in a lake

props.synopsis: A nearly two-decade study of birds living in Melbourne's Albert Park has revealed surprising relationship patterns between black swans.

title.children: The secret to a successful long-term monogamous relationship could involve taking month-long breaks — according to swans
